page.title: 11SETTLE-CARLISLE RAILWAY
page.content: THIS HISTORIC AND SCENIC LINE, UNDER THREAT OF CLOSURE, GIVES A SERVICE FOR PASSENGERS TRAVELLING TO AND FROM LEEDS AND CARLISLE. THIS CONSISTS OF TWO TRAINS DAILY EACH WAY, MORNING AND EVENING (EXCLUDING SUNDAY) WITH TWO ADDITIONAL TRAINS IN SUMMER. THE ONE STATION IN THIS AREA, KIRKBY STEPHEN, IS NORMALLY USED AS A BASE FOR LINE ENGINEERS. IN THE SUMMER THE YORKSHIRE DALES NATIONAL PARK RUNS A DALESTRAIN SERVICE ONCE MONTHLY, WHEN KIRKBY STEPHEN STATION IS OPEN TO PASSENGERS, ENABLING CITY-DWELLERS TO TO ENJOY FELL WALKING. STEAM TRAINS, CHARTERED BY RAILWAY SOCIETIES, RUN AT VARIOUS TIMES DURING THE YEAR. AVERAGING 10 SUNDAYS A YEAR THE LINE IS USED FOR RE-DIRECTED TRAFFIC FROM THE MAIN WEST COAST LINE WHILE MAINTENANCE IS CARRIED OUT.
